channel.title: Java Heap Space Error
channel.description:
I have another issue with trying to jar my client.
While the client loads, when it gets to "Unpacking Sounds", it gives me a java heap space error in the console. I know this can be fixed by allocating more memory in the batch file, but I need the jar file to work by itself to make it a webclient (to my knowledge).
Is there a way to allocate more memory in the jar file?

item.title: Java Heap Space Error
item.dc:creator: @desion desion
item.description:
@desion wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]If you’re trying to run a Jar file, it already has the arguments inside of it.
When jarring, you must specify the main class, and arguments if needed. (IE the run command)

As the run command is inside of it, you cannot change the arguments of that jar, without running it through another console.[/quote]

The jarmaker i got, does not have any options for settings the arguments or paremeters whenever jarring, just compression (best), main-class (client), class-path (blank), and sealed (blank), and to generate a batch file?

Read full topic

item.title: Java Heap Space Error
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“revengr, post:4, topic:360899”][quote author=desion link=topic=457188.msg3346190#msg3346190 date=1284857672]
What is the memory (space) currently configured too? Running locally on your computer should be set too approximately “-Xmx510m”, but if you plan on playing from the web then set it too “-Xmx1024m”.
[/quote]If I run the jar file with a batch, I set it to -Xmx512m.
However, I’m trying to get the jar file to run without using a batch file.
I might try the Eclipse thing later, but I really don’t feel like downloading that thing again for just this purpose…

[quote author=Scape-JAVA link=topic=457188.msg3346275#msg3346275 date=1284861906]
It means that the JVM has run out of all the memory that has been allocated to it. You can change the amount of memory allocated for use by your JVM using the -Xms and -Xmx command line parameters.

For example -Xm512m
[/quote]You mean edit it in the batch file?
I (think I) explained that it works fine when I add -Xmx512m to the batch.
I’m trying to run the jar without a batch, that’s why I posted this topic.[/quote]

Oops, I totally misunderstood the concept of this topic, my bad.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Heap Space Error
item.dc:creator: @revengr revengr
item.description:
@revengr wrote:

[quote=“desion, post:2, topic:360899”]What is the memory (space) currently configured too? Running locally on your computer should be set too approximately “-Xmx510m”, but if you plan on playing from the web then set it too “-Xmx1024m”.[/quote]If I run the jar file with a batch, I set it to -Xmx512m.
However, I’m trying to get the jar file to run without using a batch file.
I might try the Eclipse thing later, but I really don’t feel like downloading that thing again for just this purpose…

[quote=“Scape-JAVA, post:3, topic:360899”]It means that the JVM has run out of all the memory that has been allocated to it. You can change the amount of memory allocated for use by your JVM using the -Xms and -Xmx command line parameters.

For example -Xm512m[/quote]You mean edit it in the batch file?
I (think I) explained that it works fine when I add -Xmx512m to the batch.
I’m trying to run the jar without a batch, that’s why I posted this topic.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Heap Space Error
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

It means that the JVM has run out of all the memory that has been allocated to it. You can change the amount of memory allocated for use by your JVM using the -Xms and -Xmx command line parameters.

For example -Xm512m

Read full topic

item.title: Java Heap Space Error
item.dc:creator: @desion desion
item.description:
@desion wrote:

What is the memory (space) currently configured too? Running locally on your computer should be set too approximately “-Xmx510m”, but if you plan on playing from the web then set it too “-Xmx1024m”.

You can always try downloading Eclipse IDE for Java Developers and setup memory allocated to client by watching this video that describes how to setup a server using eclipse. Follow the steps as shown but use the client instead of server. If you choose to do this the main class will be “CLIENT” (or similar) whenever you get to that step and ignore the setting up of external jar files.

Read full topic
